instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message:
Hi to everyone :)

I have one macbook air late 2010 with board 820 2838 A

It charges perfectly, and then the light stays green (no dim, full light!), but it won't power up.
Already reinstalled <CAPACITOR>C1301</CAPACITOR> because i've found it ripped off!
Already checked all G3Hot rails and everything is fine!

What i can do in your opinion? 
thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message:
Disconnect trackpad cable and power on the board by shorting the pads (<RESISTOR>R5014</RESISTOR> or <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>).
Any history of liquid damage?

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message:
already tried, nothing happens, no chime, no fan spinning!
No, only thing that i forgot to mention is that <CHIP>U4690</CHIP> seemed to had a very little corrosion, i've cleaned and resoldered it

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message:
PIN1: It floats from 1.460 to 1.510
PIN4: 1.747

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message:
That seems ok. Getting anything on L7220 after powering on? Could be a short pulse so measure while shoring power pads. Also have you checked all coils for shorts to GND? 
Also check if <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high.

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message:
Yes, L7220 gives 5.10v
No shorted coils!
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> (PIN7 on J4700) is shorted to GND

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message: If 5V is there then a whole lot more voltages must be there. Go and check all coils for power. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> ignore for now, first need to have all power and CPU getting hot

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message:
Checked voltages on all coils: first value is for power down state, second value is taken after pressing power button

L9701:
0.001
0.001

L7260
3.3
3.3

L7220
0.0
5.10

L7030
8.40
8.40

L7560
0.0
0.0018

L7330
0.0
1.065

L7630
0.0
1.5

L7550
0.9
0.9

L7400
0.0
0.0


What you think?
thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message: Well L7560 stands out. Same enable as all the other power rails. Check for short on L7560 and check around <CHIP>U7500</CHIP>, could be dead or corrosion.

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message:
ok, i'm changing L7560.
In your opinion i can change <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> from one taken another air board? I have a Late2010 10" board.

Codes are on the 13":

9563BHZ
<RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR>
H040BBM

Other one is:

9563BHZ
<RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR>
H021BCS

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message: L7560 is fine! Is there a short to GND on L7560? And yeah an ISL9563B is an ISL9563B. Diagnose why this isn't working don't "just" replace stuff

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message: L7560 is an inductor. A large inductor. That is like a spool of wire or a slinky. Slinkies don't break. Think about this and follow duke's advice!

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820 2838 A not powering up
threads.message:
thanks guys for helping me, you were right! :)
board working perfectly now, i had to  change <CAPACITOR>C7576</CAPACITOR> around <CHIP>U7500</CHIP>, it was blown.

have a nice day!
